Posts.Content: Jul 4, 2009 07:53PM littlemanfan wrote: I recently went in for a biopsy due to calcifications.  I was on the table and ready for the whole thing to be over, when the radiologist came in the room and told me he wasn't going to do the biopsy.  I didn't need it.  I knew I had calcifications, but he told me I had "Milk of Calcium".  He said it's completely benign and that I had nothing to worry about.  I got a second opinion as I needed reassurance.  The second opinion was the same as the first.  My doctor told me that only 10-15 percent of the calcifications become cancerous.  I went to google and I found a lot of information about calcification/Milk of Calcium.  Please try not to beat yourself up worrying (yeah right~we're women...that's what we do).  Keep thinking good thoughts...you're going to be fine.
Posts.Title: calcifications found beacon800 littlemanfan

Posts.Content: Jul 5, 2009 04:33AM littlemanfan wrote: Thank you for sharing.  I wish you well as you begin this journey.  My heart goes out to you.  I recently had a scare with breast cancer, but mine turned out to be okay.  The doctors did a good job of scaring me, but I went for a second opinion and I'm glad I did.  The second opinion was the same as the first.  I needed reassurance that I didn't get from the first doctor.  Keep thinking good thoughts and take care of yourself.
Posts.Title: Right Breast Pain Led to Detection of Cancer in Left Breast Hopeful-1 littlemanfan
